title: Medea (1969)  stars  Maria Callas  and  documentary on Callas
description:
Medea (1969) starring Maria Callas directed by Pier Paolo Passolini
from the Greek tragedy by Euripedes

Originally released as a motion picture.
Special feature: bonus documentary; Tony Palmer's Film about Callas.

Italian dialogue with English subtitles. 

   This mkv file contains the English subtitles optional in your VLC or
other media player.

IMDb:tt0066065

Run time 1 hr 53 min.

Credits 

Director         Pier Paolo Passolini	
Cinematographer  Ennio Guarnieri.

Cast 	
Maria Callas, Massimo Girotti, Laurent Terzieff, Giuseppi Gentile, Margaret ClÃ©menti.

Summary 
	
To win back his kingdom, Jason must enlist the help of Medea, a powerful sorceress. But when Jason scorns her for another woman, she unleashes a firestorm of revenge.
	
My notes,

   Somewhere on the net I once got this film by Passolini and
a new dvd is now available from a production house called Entertainment One which includes  a film on the life of Maria Callas.

   The documentary of Maria Callas, a star in every larger than life sense in talent and personal bravura is a treat I could not put up to share as a separate item.

   The documentary is called  "Maria Callas: La Divina - A Portrait" (1988 TV Movie) 

   Runtime of Callas is 1 hr 10 min.

  The production of Medea is a drama and non-singing role for Callas. It gives a primitive setting for the story of Medea steeped in ritual and native costume.  There is very much an African tribal feel to the music used and the production values.

  As always, support the work by getting these classics for your libraries and theatre departments.

  
Notes written  September 10, 2016
